comment: Please do not take him. Literally take anyone else. This is supposed to be a simple and enjoyable class, and somehow, this man has created it to be more complicated than it needs to be. I was confident that i would at least get a B in this class, but I ended up with a C.. He grades extremely harshly and uses a rubric that is unclear. save urself
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Would not recommend. Professor, while knowledgeable about the topic, puts minimal effort into increasing the students' knowledge of the topic. He grades as if the student is a professional. Even if you put effort, there is no guarantee you will receive the grade you want. He often takes off points for criteria that were never stated anywhere.

He is a professor who responds rudely to emails and does not have care for students. Grades work with the expectation of already knowing how to use Excel and ect. Group project work 25% of the grade. Test monitored.

Just in general an uncaring professor, consistently unclear instructions, responds rudely to student's emails. Lost 33 points on a project because I didn't include one word which end up causing a big change in the overall grade.

Very easy class. Most weeks consisted of reading + a quiz due on Fridays. Some weeks had a project which were usually never too hard although he expects you to already know how to use Excel so he gives you the project and thats it. Class consisted of weekly quizzes + a midterm + a final + a group project, none using lockdown browser. Easy A.

This class was LOT of busy work, and it got very stressful at times making sure weekly quizzes/projects were completed on time and accurate. My issue is the fact that a few projects assigned were not taught (Excel,HTML coding), and it was left up to the student to complete with little to no direction. Perhaps this was a curriculum issue, however.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Its a pretty easy A, but I learned nothing. There isnt a ton of homework, but what there is is pretty time-consuming. There are 2 case reports, and they took me forever. He grades pretty harshly, and he is not afraid to knock off points for small errors. The group project was also way too much work.

I don't think I really learned anything in this class. There is a good bit of homework, for the most part it is just very time-consuming. He is very specific about formatting and grades harshly. The group project is a ridiculous amount of work. Definitely fairly easy to make an A in the class though.

18 quizzes, 3 lowest dropped, midterm and final. 4 discussions, 6 assignments one is an excel but its pretty easy. There is a group project at the end of the semester paper and powerpoint 2 months to work on it. I took this class online.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: He was a very fast grader and gave good feedback on assignments. Keep in mind, this class has a lot of busy work, so you cannot procrastinate. Quizzes every week, a midterm, final, several assignments that take a good amount of time to finish. There is also a group project worth 25% of your grade. Overall, not a bad class, can get stressful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall a pretty easy class, but there are lots of assignments including one group project. At least one quiz and assignment every week. Generous grader on the assignments. I missed 4/6 of the individual assignments and still managed a C so if you do the work and reading you should be fine.
